features: Streamlined, more affordable redux line version of the award-winning NH-U12S heatsink
Slim 120mm size for excellent case, RAM and PCIe compatibility: fits most tower cases (158mm height), doesn’t overhang the RAM slots, doesn’t block the PCIe on most ATX and Micro-ATX motherboards
Quiet NF-P12 redux-1700 120mm fan with PWM for automatic speed control: full cooling performance under load, near silent at idle!
Includes high-end NT-H1 thermal paste and SecuFirm2 mounting system for easy installation on Intel LGA1851, LGA1700, LGA1200, LGA115x and AMD AM5 & AM4
Renowned Noctua quality at an attractive price, smart choice for Intel Core i9, i7, i5, i3 (e.g. 14900K, 14700K, 14600K) and AMD Ryzen (e.g. 7950X3D, 7900X3D, 7800X3D, 7700)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: True to the spirit of Noctua’s redux line, the NH-U12S redux is a streamlined, accessibly priced version of the iconic NH-U12S that has established itself as a benchmark for slim, highly compatible 120mm CPU coolers. The redux version uses the same proven heatsink layout that ensures 100% compatibility with tall RAM modules as well as excellent case and PCIe compatibility. Thanks to the popular NF-P12 redux-1700 PWM fan with automatic speed control, it provides high performance under load and runs whisper-quiet at idle. At the same time, Noctua’s renowned, professional SecuFirm2 mounting system and the pre-applied NT-H1 thermal compound make installation child’s play. Backed up with Noctua’s trusted quality, the NH-U12S redux is a smart, affordable choice for a quiet, high-quality 120mm cooler.

Classic 120mm tower size for excellent case and PCIe compatibility Standing 158mm tall, the NH-U12S redux is short enough to fit most modern mid- or high-end tower cases. Measuring 125mm wide (including fan and fan clips), the cooler stays clear of the top PCIe slot on most standard ATX or Micro-ATX motherboards, ensuring optimum compatibility with multi-GPU setups. 100% RAM compatibility Thanks to its slim design with only 45mm fin depth, the NH-U12S redux will not overhang the RAM slots on any current platform. This gives the user full access to the memory modules and ensures 100% compatibility with modules that feature tall heat-spreaders or RGB lighting. Proven NF-P12 fan with PWM Specifically designed for pressure-demanding applications such as on heatsinks, the classic NF-P12 is a long-standing favourite among quiet cooling enthusiasts. The higher-speed 1700rpm redux line version supports PWM for automatic speed control, which allows it to run near silent most of the time and provide massive performance when necessary. Optional dual-fan kit The optional NA-FK1 fan kit makes it possible to upgrade the NH-U12S redux with a second fan in order to achieve even better performance. Containing a second NF-P12 redux-1700 PWM fan, fan clips, anti-vibration pads, a y-cable and Low-Noise Adaptors, it gives plenty of options to fine-tune the cooler for further improved efficiency or quietness of operation.

Measurements Height (without fan): 158 mm Width (without fan): 125 mm Depth (without fan): 45 mm Height (with fan): 158 mm Width (with fan): 125 mm Depth (with fan): 71 mm Weight (without fan): 550 g Weight (with fan): 710 g Material Nickel plated Copper (base and heat-pipes), aluminium (cooling fins) Cooler Specifications Scope of delivery NH-U12S redux heatsinkNF-P12 redux-1700 PWM fan4x NA-AVP1 grey anti-vibration padsFan mounting clips (one pair)NT-H1 high-grade thermal compound (pre-applied)SecuFirm2 mounting kit Fan compatibility 120x120x25

Streamlined redux edition Following the idea of Noctua’s redux line, the NH-U12S redux takes the proven concept of the original NH-U12S and reduces it to its essential core: a quiet, quality-made 120mm cooler with streamlined accessories that is highly compatible and easy to install.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's Noctua, what can you say
reviews.reviewText: I replaced an AIO cooler that lasted less than 2 years. This keeps my system cool, was easy to install, is quieter, and I expect it will last far more than 2 years. The AIO was nice, it dumped the heat out the top, but it was complex, pump, radiator, 3 fans, hoses. I didn't build the machine so I did not have the problems installing the AIO, It was a pain just to get it out. This is far simpler with a single fan attached to the cooler. The heat is dumped in the case, but it does fine and lets the processor run without throttling.Noctua builds nice fans and their coolers are a work of art. As far as cooling they do almost as well as an AIO. The thing is most processors are just fine with a Noctua and AIOs are just overkill. Even a "hot" gaming system works fine with Noctua.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, affordable cooler!
reviews.reviewText: Let me begin with some clarification. I have not yet used my pc with this cooler in practical applications yet. However, I have ran the Heaven benchmark and Cinebench R23 with this cooler installed. I’m running a Ryzen 7 5000 series and there is about a 25 degree difference in running those two benchmarks between the Noctua cooler and the AMD Waith stock cooler. The Noctua cooler definitely comes out ahead, which I knew it would, by a 25 degree difference. The idle temp is about 5 degrees cooler. I’d love to say the fan is quieter, but I don’t know. The fan on the Noctua cooler hasn’t had to ramp up like the AMD Wraith cooler fan had to. For the temps I was at, 53 degrees under load, I couldn’t hear the fan. While this Noctua cooler is a “budget” cooler, it has performed wonderfully thus far. Installation is very straight forward, with clear instructions for the inexperienced. Noctua makes great products and is well established in the PC cooling business.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great upgrade from AMD stock cooler
reviews.reviewText: Compared to other Nactua products the Redux line is missing some small features that allow it to be priced as low as it is. I researched to decide if these differences (a cheaper fan and the coils not being soldered to the radiator blades) and I decided it would be worth upgrading from my AMD Wraith cooler that came with my Ryzen 5 5600x. My temps were always acceptable while creeping on the hot side while under load. It wasn’t till I started ripping and compressing blu-ray files that I saw my CPU hitting 91°C with the stock cooler. Since installing this Nactua Redux my temps have dropped by 20°C while idling and under load. I’m not sure how much of a difference you’ll see if you’re already using another cooler brand but if you’re still using the stock AMD cooler I can’t recommend this enough. Instal was a breeze, sound levels are low, and it fit perfectly inside my Corsair 220T Airflow case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this a year ago for my ryzen 5600x when my aio stopped working. So I bought this and it cooled my 5600x very well. Now I have a ryzen 5800x3d and it cools it really well I never pass 72c for being an affordable cooler and only having a single fan. It’s been cooling the 105 watt chip very well. This is an amazing value and works great on most CPU’s. Don’t let the price fool you. (photo is when I had my 5600x I removed the secondary fan mounted it to my case and ran the cooler single fan for my 5800x3d now)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars In love with this cooler
reviews.reviewText: I needed an aftermarket cooler, as I have a Ryzen 5800x. I was looking for different options and found this cooler. I've heard many good things about Noctua, so I wanted to give this a chance. The moment I opened the box, I knew I had made a good decision. First, construction is excellent on this cooler; you can tell the craftsmanship was done well, and installation was a breeze. This was the most accessible mounting system I have had to do, which was what sold me. Performance was excellent, and I maintained my CPU at 39 C ( I live in a very hot area, so this is a perfect temperature). I went on to buy an additional fan, and now it's much better. I cannot recommend it anymore.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lives up to the Noctua name for half the price
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this with the optional second fan as an upgrade from the stock cooler that comes with my 5600.I had been looking at purchasing a Noctua cooler, specifically the NH-U12A or the NH-U12S but could not justify pulling the trigger on a $100+ cooler when the stock cooler was doing a good enough job. But then I found this cooler with basically the same performance for half the price, and I knew I had to get it.PROS:-AMAZING cooling! With the stock cooler, my CPU would get to 90+ degrees while performing a 10 minute Cinebench. With this cooler, it barely gets above 60 degrees while performing a 30 minute Cinebench test. While gaming, even under the most CPU stressing game I have (Dead Space Remake) it stays under 65 degrees with PBO enabled.-This thing is QUIET! Like I said, I had purchased the secondary fan for a push/pull configuration on my cooler and even with the second fan, this thing is silent. Really the only noise coming from my PC is from the GPU fans spinning up. Before, my PC was noisy with the stock cooler, but I didn't realize HOW noisy it was until I put this one in.-You cannot overtighten this cooler because of the spring loaded screws on the cooler-Comes with Noctua thermal paste pre applied, so you do not have to worry about paste, but get some just in case. Arctic mx-4 is $5 extraCONS:-It is tough to get the mounting hardware on without help. I managed to do it but it would be 100x easier with someone helping, or by removing the MOBO from the case. But I was lazy and didn't want to deal with that. Plus, some of the standoffs for my board are under where the fans end up sitting, so I still would have had issues with it.-Some people have had issues with motherboard compatibility, but this could be user error. I use a Gigabyte B550M DS3H and had no issues. This cooler uses the backplate that came with the board for AM4. Intel uses the included backplate.-The threads for the screws are on the mounting hardware, and when you loosen the screws on the cooler, they are not free of the screws on the mounting hardware, keeping you from turning the cooler to break the seal from the thermal paste. Since this comes with Noctua paste pre applied, good luck getting this off without a fight.-Attaching the fans is hard as hell, especially if you do it in your case. I found that doing the secondary fan (if you buy one) first, then the front fan is WAY easier than doing it the other way. And the fans might block standoff screws if you put them on outside of the case.I highly recommend this cooler, and its good to see that the Noctua name holds up even on a more budget option.

Great cooling performance with whisper-quiet fans.The mounting method requires you to remove the fan from the cooler and reattach it. If you are swapping your cooler, it can be a little tough to navigate inside your case and may require you to fully take your motherboard out of your case. If it is a new build (or you are swapping the case at the same time), there will be no issue, but be sure to mount the cooler and its fans before putting the motherboard in the case

Tengo un ryzen 5 5600x con una gráfica Rx 6600, vivo en una zona muy calurosa de México, con el disipador de stock normalmente me daba entro 80 y 80 grados. En cambio ya con este disipador las temperaturas no auben de los 75 grados.El sonido es casi imperceptible y tiene buena estetica.Facil de instalar si te orientas bien y puedes agregar otro ventilador en el futuro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Happy with cooler - it can handle 200 watt package indefinitely with temps topping out at about 70C after 10 minutes of full multi core load. Not loud even when fully loaded and in low 20s when idle or under a light load…but the best thing has to be the mounting bracket implementation which does a good job of both protecting the cpu during the mounting phase and ensuring there is good pressure when mounted.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noctua NH-U12S Redux: un dissipatore ad aria silenzioso e performante
reviews.reviewText: Noctua è un marchio noto per la sua qualità e le sue prestazioni, e il dissipatore NH-U12S Redux non fa eccezione.Si tratta di un dissipatore ad aria di dimensioni compatte che offre prestazioni eccellenti e un livello di rumore molto contenuto.L'NH-U12S Redux è in grado di tenere sotto controllo le temperature di processori anche di fascia alta.Utilizzato con un Intel i5 13600k che non dispone del dissipatore di serie. Cercavo un qualcosa ad aria non molto costoso ma con buone performance.La ventola Noctua NF-P12 redux-1700 PWM che accompagna il dissipatore è molto silenziosa.Nel mio caso ho acquistato anche il kit con la seconda ventola venduta a parte.Il montaggio del dissipatore è abbastanza semplice. Il kit di montaggio è completo e fornito di istruzioni chiare. Il montaggio può essere completato in pochi minuti. Fate attenzione a non stringere troppo le viti!C'è anche il QR per seguire video guide.In conclusione, è un dissipatore ad aria silenzioso e performante che offre un ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo. È una scelta ideale per chi cerca un dissipatore che mantenga le temperature sotto controllo senza produrre troppo rumore e senza spendere troppi soldi.MOLTO IMPORTANTE: Controllate se il vostro case può contenere questo dissipatore! Occupa 158mm in altezza!

reviews.reviewTitle: Lüfter super....(aber die defekte Schraub darf nicht sein)
reviews.reviewText: Vorab - der Lüfter ist leise, lässt sich auch gut montieren und ist gegenüber den normalen AMD Lüfter aus der Box - einfach super...ich besitze einen AMD 5600 - Temperatur ging von 70 Grad auf 54 im OC Betrieb.Lieferung aus Österreich - alles super, Verpackung..etc.. alles ok. Ich muss erwähnen der Lüfter wurde als Rückläufer bestellt - Gebrauchsspuren waren nicht vorhanden. Der Lüfter mit Kühler wird auf einen Rahmen montiert. Geliefert wird eine Rahmenhalterung für Intel und eine für AMD. Der Kühler wird mit zwei Schrauben an den Halterahmen montiert - ging aber nicht...jetzt kommts...in eine der zwei Schrauben steckte noch das Gewinde von der Intel Halterung die wohl einem Käufer abgebrochen war...darum Rücklauf...kurz um...mit Seidenschneider und Zange habe ich das restliche Gewinde herausbekommen und den Lüfter montiert. Mancher wird sagen schick es zurück. Ich dachte ich wage es...und es hat geklappt. Hab mir noch eine zweiten bestellt...werde falls es Probleme gibt berichten....
